application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: FELL 1 x Lime tree in front garden.applicants agreed to modify application from fell to prune:Good Morning Angus, ÿIt would be '3m Linear reduction of all scaffold limbs with biennial pruning back to the 2021 dimensions ins 2025 and 2025.ÿThank you.ÿKind Regards, ÿFrancesca WhitbreadMitigation Co-ordinatorInsurance ServicesProperty Risk Inspection LtdDDI: 01206 754983ÿÿFrom: Morrison, Angus: RBKC <Angus.Morrison@rbkc.gov.uk> Sent: 14 June 2021 08:44To: Francesca Whitbread <francesca.whitbread@propertyriskinspection.co.uk>Subject: RE: 54 Pembridge Villas ARB 21/2582 - removal of lime treeÿHi Francesca,ÿThat is good news and thank you for that.ÿCould you just confirm to me how mny metres the reduction needs to be to achieve a 70% crown reduction by volume.ÿAll the best ÿAngusÿÿAngus Morrison MArborA | Principal Arboricultural Officer | Development ManagementPlanning and Place | Royal Borough of Kensington and ChelseaÿPhone:ÿ 07739 313739http://www.rbkc.gov.uk/planningÿRegister at MyRBKC to receive alerts about new planning applications and more: https://www.rbkc.gov.uk/global/myrbkc/register-myrbkc-account ÿFrom: Francesca Whitbread <francesca.whitbread@propertyriskinspection.co.uk> Sent: 07 June 2021 11:01To: Morrison, Angus: RBKC <Angus.Morrison@rbkc.gov.uk>Subject: RE: 54 Pembridge Villas ARB 21/2582 - removal of lime treeÿGood Morning Angus,ÿFurther to our phone call and receiving the objections, I have reviewed this with our arborist and client. ÿPlease can we suggest that the recommendations are reduced to 'Hort link pruning 212. 70% crown reduction (volume) with biennial pruning management thereafter to maintain reduced form'?ÿWe can then see if the damage further persists following or if this resolves.ÿThankyou, ÿKind Regards, ÿFrancesca WhitbreadMitigation Co-ordinatorInsurance ServicesProperty Risk Inspection LtdDDI: 01206 754983
